00019 short HQSndDrv_Load(SDL_AudioSpec *AudioSpec, stHQSound *psound, const std::string& gamepath, const std::string& soundname)
00020 {
00021  SDL_AudioSpec AudioFileSpec;
00022  SDL_AudioCVT  Audio_cvt;
00023 
00024  psound->sound_buffer = NULL;
00025  std::string buf;
00026 
00027  buf = getResourceFilename("snd/" + soundname + ".OGG", gamepath, false, true); // Start with OGG
00028 
00029  if(buf != "")
00030  {
00031 #if defined(OGG) || defined(TREMOR)
00032   if(openOGGSound(buf, &AudioFileSpec,  psound) != 0)
00033    return 1;
00034 
00035   psound->enabled = true;
00036 
00037 #else
00038   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"NOTE: OGG-Support is disabled! Get another version or compile it yourself!<br>");
00039   buf = "games/hqp/snd/"+ soundname + ".WAV";
00040 
00041   std::string fullfname = GetFullFileName(buf);
00042   if(fullfname.size() == 0)
00043    return 1;
00044   
00045   // Check, if it is a wav file or go back to classic sounds
00046     if (SDL_LoadWAV (Utf8ToSystemNative(fullfname).c_str(), &AudioFileSpec, &(psound->sound_buffer), &(psound->sound_len)) == NULL)
00047     {
00048      g_pLogFile->ftextOut(PURPLE,"Wave file %s could not be opened: \"%s\". Trying to load the classical sound<br>", buf.c_str(), SDL_GetError());
00049         return 1;
00050     }
00051 #endif
00052  }
00053  else
00054  {
00055   buf = getResourceFilename("snd/" + soundname + ".WAV", gamepath, false); // Start with OGG
00056 
00057   if(buf == "")
00058    return 1;
00059 
00060   // Check, if it is a wav file or go back to classic sounds
00061   if (SDL_LoadWAV (Utf8ToSystemNative(GetFullFileName(buf)).c_str(), &AudioFileSpec, &(psound->sound_buffer), &(psound->sound_len)) == NULL)
00062   {
00063    g_pLogFile->textOut(GREEN, "Loading the classic sound : " + soundname);
00064    return 1;
00065   }
00066  }
00067 
00068  g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"File \"%s\" opened successfully!<br>", buf.c_str());
00069 
00070  int ret;
00071  /* Build AudioCVT (This is needed for the conversion from one format to the one used in the game)*/
00072  ret = SDL_BuildAudioCVT(&Audio_cvt,
00073        AudioFileSpec.format, AudioFileSpec.channels, AudioFileSpec.freq,
00074        AudioSpec->format, AudioSpec->channels, AudioSpec->freq);
00075 
00076  /* Check that the convert was built */
00077  if(ret == -1){
00078   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Couldn't convert the sound correctly!<br>");
00079   SDL_FreeWAV(psound->sound_buffer);
00080   return 1;
00081  }
00082 
00083  /* Setup for conversion, copy original data to new buffer*/
00084  Audio_cvt.buf = (Uint8*) malloc(psound->sound_len * Audio_cvt.len_mult);
00085  Audio_cvt.len = psound->sound_len;
00086  memcpy(Audio_cvt.buf, psound->sound_buffer, psound->sound_len);
00087 
00088  /* We can delete to original WAV data now */
00089  SDL_FreeWAV(psound->sound_buffer);
00090 
00091  /* And now we're ready to convert */
00092  SDL_ConvertAudio(&Audio_cvt);
00093 
00094  // copy the converted stuff to the original soundbuffer
00095  if(AudioSpec->freq == 48000)
00096  {
00097   const float factor = ((float)AudioSpec->freq)/(44100.0f);
00098   psound->sound_len = Audio_cvt.len_cvt;
00099   const unsigned long out_len = (float)psound->sound_len*factor;
00100   psound->sound_buffer = (Uint8*) malloc(out_len);
00101 
00102   resample(psound->sound_buffer, Audio_cvt.buf,
00103     out_len, psound->sound_len, AudioSpec->format, AudioSpec->channels);
00104   psound->sound_len = out_len;
00105  }
00106  else
00107  {
00108   psound->sound_len = Audio_cvt.len_cvt;
00109   psound->sound_buffer = (Uint8*) malloc(psound->sound_len);
00110   memcpy(psound->sound_buffer, Audio_cvt.buf, psound->sound_len);
00111  }
00112 
00113  // Structure Audio_cvt must be freed!
00114  free(Audio_cvt.buf);
00115 
00116  return 0;
00117 }
